ai.summary: Douglas Fir Trail is a short, easy 2.8 km forest walk in the UK, offering a pleasant circuit through Douglas fir woodland with gentle terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily a well-maintained woodland path with a mostly flat to gently rolling profile. The surface is usually firm but can become muddy after rain. Expect shaded sections and occasional tree roots near the route.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the day’s weather and wear sturdy footwear. Stay on marked paths, mind slippery leaves after rain, and watch for uneven ground. Carry water and a light layer for changing conditions. Let someone know your plan, bring a map or offline navigation, and have a charged phone for emergencies. Be mindful of local wildlife and insects, and have insect repellent in warmer months.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation and a charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) generally offers milder weather and drier conditions; it can still be enjoyed in winter with proper gear.

seo.title: Douglas Fir Trail - Easy 2.8 km Forest Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Douglas Fir Trail, a short and easy 2.8 km woodland hike in the UK. Find details on terrain, safety tips, and recommended gear for a pleasant forest walk.
